title: Terry Tao on the Future of Mathematics
blurb: Interview where Terence Tao shares views on how mathematical research may evolve and how mathematicians might work in the future.

title: A Documentary on Finding Grothendieck
blurb: A documentary-style video about people searching for Alexander Grothendieck after he withdrew from public life.

title: Geordie Williamson: Neural Networks for Mathematical Discovery
blurb: Talk on using neural networks as tools that can assist or inspire mathematical discovery.

title: Mathematical Beauty, Truth and Proof in the Age of AI (Quanta)
blurb: Quanta Magazine article discussing how AI affects notions of proof, understanding, and mathematical aesthetics.

title: Terry Tao on AI Accelerating Mundane Mathematical Tasks
blurb: Terence Tao argues that AI's greatest near-term mathematical impact will come from accelerating mundane tasks like literature reviews—already demonstrated on the Erdos Problems website, where AI-assisted searches recently reclassified six open problems as solved by uncovering obscure papers.

title: Terry Tao about Artificial General Cleverness
blurb: Terence Tao argues that while true artificial general intelligence remains elusive, we're witnessing the rise of "artificial general cleverness"—AI systems that can solve complex problems through brute force and pattern-matching rather than genuine understanding

title: The Social Proof: How Mathematical Practice is Evolving
blurb: Interviewing thirty mathematicians exposes a gap between AI hype and research reality: while headlines tout superhuman theorem-proving, working mathematicians quietly use AI for tedious tasks like searching obscure papers or proving small technical lemmas.

title: Formal or Not Formal? That Is the Question in AI for Theorem Proving
blurb: Kevin Buzzard discusses the strategic and philosophical trade-offs between formal and informal mathematics in the context of AI-assisted theorem proving, drawing on experiences from the Lean community and the Xena Project.

title: Timothy Gowers on AI and Mathematical Research
blurb: Timothy Gowers reflects on the realistic capabilities and limitations of current AI systems in mathematics, emphasizing where automation may genuinely assist research versus where human insight remains essential.

title: Emily Riehl on Proof Assistants and Mathematical Understanding
blurb: Emily Riehl reflects on the relationship between proof assistants and human mathematical understanding, arguing that formalization can enhance, but not replace, conceptual clarity.
